claim: King Kong (2005 film) was the lead actress's biggest box office role.

supporting.text: King Kong (2005) grossed over $550 million worldwide, making it one of the highest-grossing films of Naomi Watts' career.

attacks.text: King Kong (2005) grossed over $550 million worldwide, making it one of the highest-grossing films of Naomi Watts' career.
Naomi Watts starred in The Ring (2002), which grossed over $249 million worldwide, but adjusted for inflation, it might rival King Kong's earnings.
The Ring's adjusted gross is still significantly lower than King Kong's, even with inflation considered.
Naomi Watts also starred in the Divergent series, which collectively grossed over $765 million worldwide, surpassing King Kong's individual earnings.
The Divergent series' earnings are cumulative across multiple films, whereas King Kong's earnings are from a single film, making the comparison less relevant.

supporting.text: Naomi Watts' role in King Kong (2005) was widely publicized and recognized, contributing to the film's commercial success and her prominence as a lead actress.

attacks.text: Naomi Watts' role in King Kong (2005) was widely publicized and recognized, contributing to the film's commercial success and her prominence as a lead actress.
Naomi Watts starred in The Ring (2002), which grossed higher worldwide than King Kong (2005) when adjusted for inflation.

The Ring (2002) was a horror film with a smaller budget and different audience appeal, making its commercial success less indicative of Watts' prominence as a lead actress compared to King Kong (2005).
Watts' role in King Kong (2005) was overshadowed by the film's reliance on CGI and spectacle, reducing her personal impact on its box office performance.
Despite the film's CGI, Watts' performance was critically acclaimed and central to the emotional core of King Kong (2005), reinforcing her contribution to its success.

supporting.text: The Ring (2002), also starring Naomi Watts, was a major box office success and a cultural phenomenon, potentially rivaling King Kong in terms of impact and earnings.

attacks.text: The Ring (2002), also starring Naomi Watts, was a major box office success and a cultural phenomenon, potentially rivaling King Kong in terms of impact and earnings.
King Kong (2005) grossed over $550 million worldwide, significantly higher than The Ring's $249 million, making it Naomi Watts' biggest box office role.
The Ring's budget was much lower than King Kong's, so its profitability and return on investment were higher, which could be considered a greater success in financial terms.
Box office earnings are not the only measure of a film's impact; The Ring spawned a franchise and influenced the horror genre, which King Kong did not.

supporting.text: Naomi Watts starred in The Impossible (2012), which, while not as high-grossing as King Kong, earned her critical acclaim and awards recognition, making it a significant role in her career.

attacks.text: Naomi Watts starred in The Impossible (2012), which, while not as high-grossing as King Kong, earned her critical acclaim and awards recognition, making it a significant role in her career.
Box office success is typically measured by revenue, not critical acclaim, and King Kong (2005) grossed significantly more than The Impossible (2012).
Critical acclaim and awards can elevate a role's significance beyond box office numbers, especially for an actor's career trajectory.
King Kong (2005) was a blockbuster with massive marketing, which inflated its box office, while The Impossible (2012) was a smaller film with limited release.

supporting.text: King Kong (2005) had a massive budget and marketing campaign, ensuring its box office performance surpassed many of Watts' other films.

attacks.text: King Kong (2005) had a massive budget and marketing campaign, ensuring its box office performance surpassed many of Watts' other films.
Naomi Watts starred in The Ring (2002), which was a major box office success and had a higher return on investment compared to King Kong (2005).
The Ring (2002) had a much smaller budget and marketing campaign compared to King Kong (2005), making its box office success more impressive.
King Kong (2005) underperformed at the box office relative to its massive budget, making it less impactful for Watts' career compared to other films.
Despite underperforming relative to its budget, King Kong (2005) still grossed significantly more in absolute terms than most of Watts' other films.

supporting.text: Naomi Watts' involvement in smaller, independent films like Mulholland Drive (2001) may not have matched King Kong's box office but were pivotal in establishing her career.

attacks.text: Naomi Watts' involvement in smaller, independent films like Mulholland Drive (2001) may not have matched King Kong's box office but were pivotal in establishing her career.
Mulholland Drive (2001) grossed only $20 million worldwide, while King Kong (2005) earned over $550 million, making King Kong her biggest box office role by far.
Box office success does not necessarily equate to career significance; critical acclaim from independent films can have a longer-lasting impact on an actor's reputation.
